data.text:
David Ferrer is a professional tennis player from Spain. He holds several accolades and has won several titles during his career for more than ten years. Apart from being ranked 33rd in the world in men’s singles by the ATP, David has won tournaments at almost every level including the ATP 250, ATP 500 and Masters 1000. Additionally, he has won the Davis Cup three times.

In the year 2012, he won the Paris Masters, while the following year he reached the final of the 2013 French Open without dropping a set, he reached the semi-finals of the Australian and the United States twice. United, in addition to having reached the quarter-finals of Wimbledon.

David was ranked first among the top 10 tennis players world number 3 in 2013. In 2017 he beat Alexandr Dolgopolov to win the Swedish Open, his first title since winning the Vienna Open in 2015. Although David Ferrer accomplished a lot and won several titles. He has yet to win a Grand Slam tournament. We hope this will happen soon. Here are some other facts worth noting about the star tennis player.

the biography

David Ferrer was born to David Ferrer Ern on April 2, 1982 in Xàbia (eastern province of Spain) where he lived until the age of 13, when he moved to Gandia (another city in the eastern province of Spain).

Her father, Jamie Ferrer, is said to be an accountant, while her mother, Pilar Ferrer is an elementary school teacher. He has an older brother, Javier Ferrer Ern, who is a tennis coach and also runs the Ferrer Tenis Academia.

Career

Although Ferrer developed the love and passion for tennis in his early teens, he was so lazy to practice that his coach, Javier Piles, locked him in a dark room for several hours and only gave him a piece of bread and a little water until he agrees to train quite hard. become a professional tennis player. After Ferrer turned professional, Javier Piles remained his coach until he was replaced by Jose Francisco Altur in 2013.

At fifteen, David has to move to Before returning to his hometown, Xàbia, he also trained at the Juan Carlos Ferrero Villena Academy for almost a year in Barcelona. While she was at the academy, the Spanish FA instead chose to sponsor Tommy Robredo over him, forcing Ferrer to turn professional on his own.

David Ferrer became a professional tennis player in 2000. That year he won F1 in Poland, F3 in Spain and finished second in Spanish F1. He ends the year as world number one. 419. The following year, he recorded his first career title in the Challenger. He also reached the semi-finals in Manerbiography, Spain, F15 and F16 respectively.

In 2002, he won his first ATP title after reaching his first ATP final at his second ATP event in Umag. By the end of 2004, he had reached No. 49 in the world in the men’s singles rankings. By 2005, he had moved up further to 14th after winning his first ATP titles in Acapulco and Viña del Mar. He had also reached a career high of $951,772.

Ferrer was part of the Spanish team that won the Davis Cup in 2008, 2009 and 2011. He also won the Masters tournaments and was a runner-up six times.

He won his 25th career title at the 2015 Kuala Lumpur Open after defeating Feliciano López in an all-Spanish final, Thew Spaniard also makes history as the first Spaniard to win the title in Kuala Lumpur. In 2017, he defeated Alexandr Dolgopolov to win the Swedish Open, which became his first ATP Tour title after the 2015 Vienna Open.

Net value

The Spanish player currently has an estimated net worth of $10 million. This figure is mainly due to his earnings from his almost two-decade career.

David Ferrer’s wife, son and daughter

After dating for several years, David tied the knot with longtime girlfriend Marta Tornel at a ceremony in Valencia, Spain on November 28, 2015. The couple were introduced by Ferrer’s former coach Javier Piles and his wife.

The Spaniard took to his Instagram to announce the arrival of his first child (son) with his wife Tornel. Little Leo arrived in May 2018.

Height and other facts

Ferrer stands at 6″8 (1.75m) and weighs 73kg.

Interestingly, the tennis player loves basketball and plays it too. He also loves football and supports Valencia CF.

David likes to read. According to him, he read books to help him improve as a person and not just as a tennis player.

Her all-time favorite book is Queen of the South (La Reina del Sur), written by Perez-Reverte. His favorite novelists are Ildefonso Falcones and Arturo Perez-Reverte.
